name: Auto Hogar Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the auto hogar in mid Sept. From reading the numerous bad reviews on this website about air con not working and noise (Rather stupidly after booking the hotel), we asked at check-in for a 'quiet and air conditioned room'. We were directed through the car park to a room on the 5th floor. The room was rather small and its only view was three walls, i.e we ere in the centre of the hotel. Thankfully the air conditioning, shower etc did work. The room did have a safe however we were unable to open it.
reviews.title: Clean but noisey

reviews.text: Despite asking specifically for a quiet room we found our room quite noisey, not from the traffic outside but from the traffic passing by our room. Our room was right beside the elevator and the walls were like cardboard. Everything could be heard. Also at the time it appeared that building work was ongoing which added to the noise level.
reviews.title: Low Budget DUMP!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a good note though, the location is brilliant and the buffet breakfast was fantastic with plenty of choice. The rooms and towels were cleaned/changed daily (Although we had left the 'do not disturb' sign, on the door each day they still came in, so i wouldnt advise leaving valuables/money lying around, not that we had any problems)
reviews.title: Great break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all I guess you get what you pay for. I wouldnt recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet, relaxing holiday. Its more suitable for younger people who will be out all day sightseeing and out on the town until late every night. (Although thats what we were doing most of the time and we still found the noise annoying the odd time were were there) I wouldnt return to this hotel again, id rather pay a little extra for a nicer hotel or do my research a bit better!!!
reviews.title: Initially disappointed but eventually very happy!

likes.disliked: — The first rooms lack of air conditioning!

reviews.text: This place was a dump. Stayed there for 2 nights in June. Where do I start ... Room was tiny, air conditioner was broken, shower was broken, telephone was broken, room was old and run down. We asked if we can be moved to another room but they said they were full. The next night they moved us to the newer part of the hotel and it was no better. Would never stay or recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: What No Air Con?!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights and really got what I was looking for - cheap, clean and central. The hotel is 50yds walk from the nearest metro station (Paral Lel) and 10 minutes walk to Las Ramblas and the waterfront. Sagrada Familia is reached on the same line (15 minutes) and the bus station 20 minutes with 1 change on the metro. Buffet breakfast is included and ok (served 7.30 - 10.30), but don't leave it until 10am to go down for it, as it is pandemonium!!! The hotel itself is clean if a little outdated, and the room I had was clean but very basic -all things that are reflected by the cheap cost. The only real downside was the noise, there is no sound proofing, so you hear every movement from every angle - only shear exhaustion from too much walking will guarantee a good nights sleep. My advice is if you don't care where you stay on a short visit, it's ok, but if you prefer more comfort and style, and you are staying longer than 2 nights, then don't bother.
reviews.title: Great price, very clean, but noisy!

likes.liked: — It's location was excellent for it's price
likes.disliked: — The lack of sound proofing - very noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one week in Barcelona and at Auto Hogar. From Hotels.com we got very good pricing for the reservation and were actually a bit of afraid was it too good to be true... But everything was just great! The room was big and nice. There wasn't really anything extra in the room, just the very basic things which normally are in every hotel rooms. But that was just enough for us. Location was also perfect, everything in walking distance, Metro stop just next to the hotel. Well of course, as Barcelona is a big city, you could hear the noise from outside. But we got used to it quite fast.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise

likes.liked: — Value for the money we paied. Everything basic was there, apartment was always cleaned up very well!
likes.disliked: — The noise from other rooms (door banging).

reviews.text: I guess we cot a bit lucky with the room we got but still; we can warmly recommend the hotel to travelers who doesn't need anything extra, just a safe place to sleep their nights. :)
reviews.title: Take your sleeping pills!

likes.disliked: — Noise from lifts and other guests all night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled in October 06 to Barcelona. I had read other comments about this hotel so was a little apprehensive, however this was cheap and in a fantastic location. Staff all spoke english and were pleasent. Yes, you have to walk through a car park to reach the lifts to the rooms - a little annoying... My room was very very basic. This room was next to the lift shaft, so all night, I was awoken by the lifts going up and down... The whole hotel is tiled flooring, which makes all the noise travel... After a sleepless night, I requested a room change. The staff accomadated this. My new room was not much better, still close to the lift area, so still very noisy. This hotel is preety much in the centre of Barcelona, which is the only saving grace. If you choose to stay here, be prepared for a lot of noise at night and little sleep... SG Australia...
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel on the 30th October for 3 nights. The Hotel is in a great location with easy access to the Metro and La Rambla.
reviews.title: good clean budget hotel
You have to walk THROUGH the garage! A/C in part of the hotel is broken!
reviews.text: The next day after sightseeing we were shown to a room on the 7th floor, accessed via the lifts inside the lobbey. Despite being compact and very small (we lived out of our suitcases rather than putting our clothes in the damp wardrobe) it was cool and air conditioned which was all we were after. I'd definitely say temperature is more important than the space here. The room had a view looking over the best sites of the city including the Montjuic area and Sagrada Familia.
Stayed here for 4 nights during a large conference which was at the nearby Barcelona Fira.
reviews.title: Basic budget hotel near the Fira

likes.disliked: — Lack of internet access in the rooms

reviews.title: Basic but adequate
reviews.text: On the positive side, the hotel was 15 minutes walk or 2 metro stops from the Fira. I can't oversate enough the importance of this when you see the hundreds of people queuing for taxis outside the Fira main gates at 7pm.

reviews.title: What a hovel, not for the claustrophobic
reviews.text: My room was on 6th floor in the main part of the hotel (not the part accessed through the car park!). The room faced the main road, which could be noisy if you are not used to traffic noise. On the whole, it was not a problem, apart from one night where a large number of people were gathered on the far side of the road making a lot of noise at 5am. My guess is that it was closing time of some nearby nightclub!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is also within easy walking distance to Las Ramblas. The fact that the hotel is on a main road means a good supply of taxis driving past at all times.
reviews.title: Cheap and Central Base
I'm sure the main hotel is fine... but a word of warning
reviews.text: Based on the reviews on this and other sites we stayed at the Auto Hogar on a hot July weekend.

reviews.title: Low Budget Hotel at Mid-Budget Price
reviews.text: First impressions were fine and we made our way to our rooms which were, surprisingly, accessed through the garage at the rear of the hotel. Here there is a second and much more run down hotel.

reviews.title: Simple but nice!
reviews.text: My word of warning is to avoid this part of the Auto Hogar like the plague! With two airless rooms without working air conditioning we asked to change rooms. WIth no more space available the management suggested we sleep with our doors open!

reviews.title: Unimpressed!
reviews.text: Not satisfied with this option, we were eventually re-housed in the Hotel Nuevo Triunfo round the corner (+93 442 59 33). That was cool, quiet, friendly and perfect. Worth a call but haggle on the price - our rate was 25% below the advertised tarrif. Sadly this was an attempt to check out the Auto Hogar ahead of a larger trip coming later in the year. On this experience we won't be staying there and my advice is that if you are sent to your room through the garage you either get another room or check out immediately!

The A/C did not work. It was so hot. TV only got 2 spanish-language stations. There was a lot of noise on the street in the middle of the night. The neighborhood was fine, but not the best. To get to our room we had to walk through a mechanic's garage. The elevator was out most of our stay. Again, it was so hot. The staff was nice and the breakfast was decent. It was near the metro station and a short walk to Las Ramblas, but avoid the alleys. The room was big but both it and the bathroom were not very clean, although the entire place smelled of industrial soap. If the A/C had worked, it probably wouldn't have seemed as bad.
reviews.title: surprised!
Hotel OK but....the noise...the noise!!
reviews.text: Just a quick review as hotel was ideally situated, looks ok from outside and service is fine BUT.....before you book to stay here please conduct a small experiment to check your suitability.. Go into your local town centre pub at 10pm on a saturday night and see if you can knock out some zeds whist your there! We stayed in room 408 for three nights and by night 3 I was starting to hallucinate through lack of sleep! The only times you can get some shuteye is from 11am to 5pm (main tourist times) from 6pm to 3am the constant noise is unbearable and might drive lesser men to acts of irrational violence ha ha! Seriously think carefully about staying here if sleep is high on your list of priorities and thanks very much to the young french couple in room 409 for shouting incessantly until 3am every night...

description: Auto Hogar Hotel is located in the most centric zone of Barcelona, 10 minutes walking distance to Las Ramblas Boulevard, the port and Plaza España, a place of celebration of fairs and congresses, filled with non stop fun and entertainment, the traditional theater’s area all around Paral•lel avenue, the beach, the Gothic quarter, restaurants and the Olympic harbor; all at walking distance. The Hotel also has a historic cafe / restaurant Café Español, a meeting place in the Paral•lel’s area. There is parking in the same building. In early 2013, it completed the refurbish of the 153 rooms in the Hotel, equipped with new stylish furniture, full bathrooms, climate controlled, direct telephone line and television, select rooms include private balconies with a lovely view of Barcelona. The meeting room Teatre, with capacity for 30 persons, where you can organize all kind of events, from business meetings to social events.
